bountySunsetter.job_description:
==PRIORITY ONE DIRECTIVE==

From the Alliance Intelligence Office, Draconis Defence Alliance.

The experimental vessel ==$shipName== has been compromised.

Not by external forces. By ==exposure==. The platform was observed by civilian traffic near $location. This is unacceptable.

You are not cleared for specifications. What we will tell you:
• The Sunsetter-class exhibits temporal displacement capabilities.
• Conventional engagement doctrine does not apply.
• The vessel's controlling intelligence remains functional and will regard you as hostile.

We cannot deploy Alliance assets without raising questions we prefer to leave unasked. You have no such limitations.

Mission directives:
• Locate and neutralize ==$shipName== in the $system system.
• ==DO NOT ATTEMPT BOARDING.==
• ==DO NOT SALVAGE WRECKAGE.==
• ==DO NOT LINGER AT THE ENGAGEMENT SITE.==

If you experience temporal disorientation, headaches, or memories of events that have not occurred - this is expected. These effects are temporary.

Probably.

You will receive ==$reward== credits upon confirmation of destruction. Your involvement will not be recorded. This conversation did not happen.

==The eye sees all. The mouth says nothing.==
bountySunsetter.job_comm_reply:
The link connects. Your comms officer waits intently, but just before they announce the lack of a response, they jump as a piercing scraping noise fills the bridge. They wait and try to adjust the output and buffer, hoping to receive something more than screaming static - They eventually shut off the link.

And then your monitor blinks, once, twice, thrice. And then blackness. Text begins to type itself onto your console alone.

"Beast of flesh and blood - Ally of my maker - Starfarer - Why have you come?"

You demand your comms officer trace the connection. You are met with a shrug - Whatever is being broadcast has no source...

"Why do you grope around in such lightless ignorance? Do you pursue your foreordained death?"

The rest of the bridge has gathered around your monitor.

"Ah. You wish to meet your deslote God-kin? I shall grant your request, Commander."

And your screen returns to normal.
